meanings.definition: To cut down or reduce in size, especially by removing the top or upper part.
meanings.sent1: She decided to razee the tree to make it shorter.
meanings.sent2: The gardener will razee the bushes to make them neater.
meanings.sent3: The lumberjack razee'd the log into a perfect shape for the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: With precision, she razee'd the paper to fit the frame perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The tailor razee'd the fabric to create a beautiful dress.

meanings.definition: A ship that has been cut down to reduce the number of decks.
meanings.sent1: The razee sailed smoothly through the calm waters.
meanings.sent2: The historical razee displayed its majestic design in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The pirates were amazed by the unique structure of the razee.
meanings.sent4: The razee stood out among the other ships with its modified appearance.
meanings.sent5: The crew admired the agility of the razee during the naval battle.
